messages.title: Putting money back in your pocket
messages.content: Almost everyone I know has found life tough over the last year or so. Now more than ever people need more money in their pockets to help them get by. But there's no sign of that coming from this tired Labour Government. Instead we have the prospect of paying more and more in tax, while getting less and less in return.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Taxes for the Rich and Poor
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The leaflet proposes a tax plan launched by Nick Clegg and Vince Cable that promises no tax on the first £10,000 you earn and raising taxes on the rich with both plans aiming at making the tax system fairer.
The candidate suggests changes to taxes on pollution and introducing a new 'mansion tax' on homes that are worth over £2million.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Most recent election results show that either the Lib Dems or the Conservatives will win in Reading East. Labour are in freefall, out of the race.

issues.governance: There's little hope of help from the Conservatives either. The Conservatives' priority on tax is to give a £2bn tax cut to 3,000 millionaires... Only the Lib Dems promise you something different - real change and fairness.
issues.economy: Labour Government is associated with the prospect of paying more in tax, while getting less in return, which the leaflet criticizes heavily.
issues.environment: Supporting the introduction of a 'mansion tax' on homes that are worth over £2million.

housing.content: Supporting the introduction of a 'mansion tax' on homes that are worth over £2million.

images.caption: Photo of Gareth EPPS with the Lib Dem logo
